title: Investors Lose Their Marbles as MSCI U-Turn Spurs 98% Stock Plunge
summary: After a near 40-fold increase this year, Hong Kong-listed ArtGo was on the verge of inclusion in influential indexes. A marble-mining stock crashed 98% Thursday morning, shedding $5.7 billion of market value, after MSCI Inc. dropped plans to add the Hong Kong-listed company to its indexes.

title: Saugus High Shooter Used 'Ghost Gun' Built From Parts
summary: Nathan Berhow's .45 caliber handgun was built from components easily purchased online. The gun used in the Southern California high-school shooting last week was a "ghost gun" with no serial number, law-enforcement officials said Thursday.

title: Fiona Hill Calls Theories About Election Interference by Ukraine False
summary: Former national-security official, U.S. diplomat round out two weeks of public impeaching hearings. WASHINGTON-A former White House official said a theory that Ukraine interfered in the 2016 U.S. elections was a "fictional narrative" fueled by Russian propaganda, rejecting President Trump's rationale for pushing Kyiv to investigate the matter and arguing the effort amounted to a "political errand" outside formal diplomatic channels.

title: Georgia Gov. Kemp Resists Pressure From Trump on Senate Appointment
summary: President is pressing for Rep. Doug Collins to be named interim senator, but the governor is leaning toward a woman or minority for the post. ATLANTA-Georgia Republican Gov. Brian Kemp is resisting pressure from President Trump on who to appoint to an interim U.S. Senate post, according to people familiar with the selection process.

title: David Holmes Says U.S. Officials Understood Trump Was Pressing for Biden Investigation
summary: State Department official tells impeachment investigators that embassy colleagues were aware of the developments by midsummer. WASHINGTON-A career diplomat told House impeachment investigators that he believed there was a clear understanding among U.S. officials in Kyiv by midsummer that President Trump had been pressing to get the Ukrainian government to announce investigations into matters that would benefit him politically.

title: Beijing's New Hong Kong Protest Strategy: Let 'Em Fight It Out
summary: Semiautonomous city's leaders and police chiefs adopt harsher line demanded by President Xi Jinping. HONG KONG-Chinese President Xi Jinping's demands for an unflinching crackdown on antigovernment protests in Hong Kong have locked the city's government into escalating a battle of attrition with increasingly militant demonstrators.

title: Best-Selling Books Week Ended November 16
summary: With data from NPD BookScan.

title: New York City Moves to Ban Flavored E-Cigarettes
summary: Full city council will vote next week on the bill, which the mayor supports. The New York City Council is expected to approve next week a ban on the sale of nearly all flavored e-cigarettes and e-liquids, the latest attempt to restrict the sale of such products in New York.

title: Facebook Weighs Steps to Curb Narrowly Targeted Political Ads
summary: Tech firms are reversing a yearslong trend of offering ever-more precise tools that in some cases facilitated the spread of misinformation. The dominant U.S. tech platforms for digital political advertising are taking steps to limit the level of detail that political campaigns or other groups can use to target voters, reversing a yearslong trend of offering ever-more precise tools that in some cases facilitated the spread of misinformation.

title: Report: Election Security Agency Grapples With Staffing, Budget Cuts
summary: Executive director and general counsel both stepped down last month. The federal agency responsible for setting election security standards is grappling with key leadership vacancies and inadequate funding, a new report by a government watchdog office has found.

title: Trump's Defenders Have No Defense
summary: Witnesses were uneven, but even his closest allies don't try to deny he did what he's accused of doing.. Look, the case has been made. Almost everything in the impeachment hearings this week fleshed out and backed up the charge that President Trump muscled Ukraine for political gain. The pending question is what precisely the House and its Democratic majority will decide to include in the articles of impeachment, what statutes or standards they will assert the president violated.

title: The Supreme Court's Textualism Test
summary: Kagan tries to lure Gorsuch and Roberts off the Scalia method.. It won't grab headlines like impeachment, but a major political drama this year will unfold at the Supreme Court. To wit, how will the Court, and especially new Justices Neil Gorsuch and Brett Kavanaugh, define the meaning of textualism and originalism?

title: About Those 'Freeloading' Billionaires
summary: Who would do more with $1.08 billion-Bill Gates or Elizabeth Warren?. The Democratic presidential candidates gathered for a debate in Atlanta Wednesday, and with top-tier progressives Bernie Sanders and Elizabeth Warren present, the talk naturally turned to billionaires. "We also have to stand up to the fact that our political system is corrupt," said Mr. Sanders, "dominated by a handful of billionaires."

title: Of Ballots and Bias in California
summary: The state Supreme Court tosses a law aimed solely at Trump.. Good legal news, and from California of all places. The Golden State Supreme Court on Thursday struck down a state law requiring President Trump to disclose his income-tax returns to appear on the state primary ballot next year. It's good to see that some liberal jurists won't abandon fundamental legal principles merely to hurt an unpopular President.

title: Democratic Debate Watched by 6.6 Million Viewers
summary: Ratings declined for latest such broadcast, which aired on MSNBC after impeachment hearings on Capitol Hill. The Democratic presidential debate carried live on MSNBC Wednesday night drew 6.6 million viewers, according to Nielsen, which is the smallest audience so far in the race to determine who will take on President Trump in the 2020 election.

title: Why Aren't Buttigieg Rivals Talking About South Bend?
summary: Another successful debate for the leader in Iowa.. As Democratic mayors go, Pete Buttigieg may be nobody's Tom Henry. But the South Bend sensation had another successful outing in a presidential campaign debate on Wednesday, thanks to his rivals' lack of interest in South Bend.

title: Charles Schwab Holds Talks to Buy TD Ameritrade
summary: Deal could value TD Ameritrade at about $26 billion and would reshape the discount-brokerage market. Charles Schwab Corp. is in talks to buy TD Ameritrade Holding Corp. in a deal that would reshape the discount-brokerage market, where millions of individual investors buy and sell stocks.

title: Warren's Medicare Blunder
summary: She makes her plan slightly less radical. That's likely to leave everyone unhappy.. Sen. Elizabeth Warren admitted last Friday that she had made a colossal, potentially fatal, campaign error-and immediately proceeded to make it worse. If the Warren presidential bid flops, this will be the moment to mark.

title: Diplomats Play Partisans on TV
summary: Foreign-service officers are tough and courageous. You wouldn't know it from the impeachment hearings.. I think the House impeachment inquiry is a partisan fishing expedition, but as a former U.S. foreign-service officer, I tuned in to the hearings rooting for my erstwhile colleagues to acquit themselves well. Instead, the hearings were a made-for-TV spectacle in which foreign-service officers were used as props in a political drama.

title: A Hindu-Muslim Clash, a Jury-Rigged Fix
summary: In the Ayodhya ruling, India's high court opts for pragmatism over legal clarity.. Anyone who has visited India for longer than a few days is likely familiar with jugaad, a Hindi word that describes a workaround solution to a problem, often a clumsy fix that cuts corners or bends rules. The closest English equivalents are "hack" and "kludge," methods employed when conventional solutions are costly, arduous or impossible.

title: Heartbreak for Kurdish-Americans
summary: It's painful to watch our adopted country betray our homeland.. What does the U.S. want for the Middle East? As Kurdish-Americans, we always believed Washington was working with its regional allies to create the kind of democratic society our families found when they risked everything to come to the U.S. The Kurds-like people everywhere-seek lives of peace and opportunity. When we lost hope in our homeland, many of us flourished here in America.

title: Inside Beijing's Ministry for Taking Things Away
summary: The Communist Party no longer has the resources to buy affection, so it resorts increasingly to coercion.. Last weekend's publication of leaked documents about Beijing's abuses of China's Uighur citizens was so shocking on its face that many subtle points may have been lost. One of the more important is the extent to which China's political economy has shifted from giving-things-out mode to taking-things-away mode.

title: 'The Season' Review: Welcome to Society
summary: Unlike the marriageable ingénue of yesterday, the modern debutante ﬁnds herself bowing to strangers whom she is unlikely to meet again.. Kristen Richardson's relatives who spawn debutantes kept pleading with her not to be "mean" and "arch" when she wrote her book. They can breathe easily. By identifying the debutante custom as a minor part of women's history, "The Season" confers more dignity on it than do those annual posh magazine spreads picturing Texan heiresses and the offspring of movie stars venturing abroad to meet the scions of defunct aristocracies.

title: An Autocracy of Feelings Overwhelms America
summary: A democracy needs as much thought as it can get. Ours isn't getting much.. An earnest young writer turned in a story about how Sen. Eugene McCarthy had irritated his financial backers. It was spring 1968, and I was filling in as an editor of Time magazine's Nation section. The young man wrote: "Senator McCarthy ruffled the feathers of the fat cats." The metaphor was so inspired-it conjured such a marvelous little creature-that it broke my heart to delete it.

title: Liberal Teardrops on Taylor Swift's Guitar
summary: She's worth hundreds of millions of dollars. Why would Elizabeth Warren declare her a martyr?. Pop star Taylor Swift raked in $266 million from her 2018 album tour and tops the Forbes list of highest-paid celebrities. So it's ironic that progressives are hailing Ms. Swift, 29, as a martyr of capitalism. She complained that a music agent (and Democratic fundraiser) backed by a private-equity firm was refusing to let her play her own tunes Sunday at the American Music Awards, where she'll be feted as Artist of the Decade.

title: Trump Says Navy Won't Eject SEAL Charged With War Crimes
summary: President says on Twitter that Edward Gallagher's case was mishandled. WASHINGTON-President Trump signaled he would block any move by the Navy to oust a SEAL member charged with war crimes after intervening in the case last week.

title: Nevada Regulators Pass New Harassment Policy
summary: Policy more explicitly requires casinos to address discrimination in the workplace, including sexual harassment. Nevada gambling regulators approved a new policy that more explicitly requires casinos to address discrimination in the workplace, including sexual harassment.

title: Power Companies Challenge Mexican Rule Change on Clean Energy
summary: They say regulation changes reduce the value of their investments and could risk environmental targets. MEXICO CITY-At least half a dozen clean-energy companies are taking legal action against the Mexican government over changes in regulations they say reduce the value of their investments and put the country's environmental targets at risk.

title: Xerox Threatens to Go Hostile With HP Takeover Bid
summary: HP rejected Xerox's acquisition offer as too low and not in the best interests of its shareholders. Xerox Holdings Corp. said in a letter to HP Inc.'s board of directors that it would take its $33 billion takeover bid to HP's shareholders if the company doesn't reconsider Xerox's acquisition offer by Nov. 25.

title: Champagne, Cigars and a Bribe: The Charges Against Israel's Netanyahu
summary: Israeli Attorney General Avichai Mandelblit indicted Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu after two years of probes and nearly a year of legal proceedings. Israeli Attorney General Avichai Mandelblitcharged Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu with one count of bribery, and three counts of fraud and breach of trust after two years of corruption probes and nearly a year of legal proceedings.

title: New York City Homeless-Shelter Residents Bash Food
summary: Councilman describes testimony by residents at hearing as 'very disturbing'. Homeless shelters across New York City are serving substandard food, a half-dozen shelter residents said Thursday at a City Council hearing.

title: Dollar Edges Higher as Trade Tensions Build
summary: Doubts about whether a U.S.-China trade deal can be signed this year has boosted the dollar. The dollar crept higher Thursday, as investors awaited developments in trade talks between the U.S. and China.

title: Democratic Senators Want the Fed to Better Prepare Banks for Climate Change
summary: Lawmakers believe central bank needs to 'stress test' banks for severe-weather events. A group of Democratic senators, half of whom currently running for president, are supporting a new bill that would direct the Federal Reserve to formally factor climate-change risks into its oversight of large financial firms.

title: Bearish Oil-Drilling Indicator Is Full of Holes
summary: Energy traders' assumptions may be way off. Things are looking down for oil prices, but a key plank of the market's bearish argument may be rotten.

title: Macy's Posts Lower Sales; Cuts Forecast
summary: Retailer reports decline in profit as traditional department stores struggle to attract shoppers. Macy's Inc. said sales declined in the third quarter, and it lowered its guidance for the year, highlighting the struggle to attract shoppers to traditional department stores.

title: Renowned Investor Bacon to Return Client Cash
summary: Recent woes for prominent investor came amid challenges using traditional investing methods. Louis Bacon, who spent decades placing outsize and often successful bets on global markets, is returning client cash and ending his career managing the money of others, he said Thursday.

title: The Future of Online Trading Is in Banking and Wealth Management
summary: Potential merger between TD Ameritrade and Charles Schwab would help the pair bulk up in areas beyond commission-free trading. First beat your rivals up on price, and then buy one. If that is how things play out for Charles Schwab , investors could stand to gain.

title: 'The Feed' Review: Minor Technical Difficulties
summary: In a not-too-distant sci-fi future, a streaming service beamed into people's brains starts experiencing problems.. The formula for classic science fiction has always appeared pretty basic: Take a hard look at the human capacity for cupidity, stupidity and susceptibility and pick the cliff that we're eventually going over. Given that the 10-part Amazon Studios thriller "The Feed" seems to be set on the day after tomorrow, it barely qualifies as futuristic. But it does have an inescapable air of inevitability.

title: 'The Chaperone' Review: Traveling Companions With Baggage
summary: Julian Fellowes and Elizabeth McGovern of 'Downton Abbey' fame reunite for the story of a housewife who volunteers to accompany a young Louise Brooks to New York.. The year 1922 was the Big One for Modernism. "Ulysses" was published. So was "The Waste Land." Brecht's "Drums in the Night" had its stage debut and Joan Miró finished "The Farm." Meanwhile getting on a train in Wichita, Kan., to join the modern dance company of Ruth St. Denis was actress-to-be Louise Brooks-"the most seductive, sexual image of Woman ever committed to celluloid," as the British critic Kenneth Tynan described her in 1979. Brooks was a wonder, a sex symbol of disturbing volatility, but what's also evident now in her silent movies-specifically "Diary of a Lost Girl" and "Pandora's Box"-is how she occupied the space between her medium and her audience, creating a unique kind of screen acting, a way of existing on film that still seems new today.

title: Blackstone Cashes Out of Rental-Home Empire
summary: Firm sells the last of its stake in Invitation Homes, the company it created after the housing crisis to scoop up foreclosed properties and rent them out. Blackstone Group Inc. has closed the door on its giant rental-home gambit.

title: 'A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood': Healing Arts
summary: Goodness carries the day in Marielle Heller's film about beloved TV host Fred Rogers, who is played by Tom Hanks.. Tom Hanks is Fred Rogers, the beloved TV host, in "A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood." It's a perfect piece of casting for an inspirational fable in which forgiveness opens the way to a state of grace. Fred, turning his gifts for kindness and empathy on a cynical magazine writer who has come to profile him, helps the man heal his angry heart. The story plays out in a pair of realms that sometimes overlap or merge-the real world of the journalist and the fantasy world of "Mister Rogers' Neighborhood," where life lessons for kids are dispensed with gentle eloquence at an unhurried pace. Given the nature of the production-it was made for grownups, not children, in an era when life moves much faster than it did in Mr. Rogers's day-sticky sweetness threatens at every turn, along with naked contrivance. Yet the movie bets on goodness, and wins.

title: 'Dark Waters': A Deep Dive for the Truth
summary: Mark Ruffalo stars in his passion project about an environmental lawyer seeking justice for a West Virginia farmer.. Mark Ruffalo plays a suddenly impassioned environmental attorney in "Dark Waters," a story that was his passion project; he took it to the director Todd Haynes, then served as one of the film's producers as well as its star.

title: 'Frozen 2': A Franchise Cools Off
summary: Famous actors and beloved characters return in a sequel that stumbles musically.. Franchises don't lend themselves to startling innovation. Or even freshness. They feed off their own formulas. "Frozen 2"-the sequel to one of Disney's most successful excursions into animated musicals, bowdlerized fairy tales and Broadway spinoffs-is everything that the hardcore fan will want. It will delight many. It won't surprise any. It may drive others still to the concession stand. Given the year at the box office, theaters owners will appreciate the revenue.

title: 'Citizen K' Review: From Oligarch to Activist
summary: Alex Gibney's documentary tells the story of Mikhail Khodorkovsky alongside that of another Russian much more familiar to American audiences: Vladimir Putin. The Kafka-inspired title of Alex Gibney's documentary "Citizen K" refers to Mikhail Khodorkovsky, onetime Russian oligarch, longtime inmate of a Siberian prison and current London-based activist. He is not, for most Americans, a household name. So Mr. Gibney gives equal time to someone who is: Vladimir Putin, a man who scoffs at democratic processes, sneers at independent media, and owes his prominence largely to television. His relevance to American audiences can't be overstated.

title: 'Sopranos' Convention Treats Fans Like Family
summary: Resume Subscription. Most tourists come to the New York metropolitan area to visit such landmarks as the Statue of Liberty and Empire State Building. Mark Raat came to obsess about "The Sopranos."

title: Shares of TD Ameritrade, Schwab Jump on Deal Report
summary: Past tie-ups between e-brokers have generally been seen as successful because the combining firms have quickly reaped the benefits of scale. title: Pelosi Skeptical U.S.-Canada-Mexico Trade Deal Will Pass This Year
summary: House speaker says Congress may not have enough time to approve pact before year's end. WASHINGTON-House Speaker Nancy Pelosi cast doubt Thursday on whether Congress will be able to pass President Trump's renegotiated North American trade agreement this year.

summary: Federal death penalty, unused for 16 years, was to be restarted next month. WASHINGTON-The Trump administration on Thursday appealed a federal court order blocking its plans to resume executions on the Justice Department's death row for the first time in 16 years.

summary: Former vice president is choice of 24% of state Democrats surveyed by Siena. Former Vice President Joe Biden has retaken the title as New York Democrats' preferred presidential candidate, a poll released Thursday shows.

title: The Latest Advice on Heart Health Seems Like a Tall Order
summary: Sadly, it's a little too late for some of us to suddenly get small. I was feeling pretty good about my long-term health prospects until I read a horrifying report about heart disease issued by the University of Pennsylvania. I'd lost a ton of weight, started walking 3 miles a day and cut way back on carbs and fatty foods. I'd started eating a lot more beets and berries, massively increased my consumption of probiotic yogurt and cod liver oil, and developed a grudging affection for kombucha. And I'd all but eliminated that daily ice cream sandwich from my diet.

title: Mechanical Wonders That Were Fit for a King
summary: In early modern Europe, royal collections blurred the line between art and science.. The princes of early modern Europe had a boundless appetite for mechanical wonders and scientific curiosities. Primitive calculators and automatons that could write piled up in castles from Portugal to Poland, alongside ingeniously made pieces of jewelry and gilded casts of beetles and frogs. "Making Marvels: Science and Splendor at the Courts of Europe," a new exhibition opening Nov. 25 at New York's Metropolitan Museum of Art, gathers more than 150 such items from the "cabinets of curiosities"-in German, Wunderkammer-that were popular from the 16th to the 18th centuries.

title: Dreading the Flu Shot? More Needles Might Help.
summary: The makers of microneedle patches believe they've found a replacement for traditional vaccines and acute-migraine treatments, but challenges remain. Author

title: 'Pizzazz': How to Bring Excitement to Impeachment Hearings (or Anything Else)
summary: Bored pundits said they yearned for more of a term that dates to the 1930s to mean 'razzle-dazzle.' Then Gordon Sondland testified.. When the public hearings of the impeachment inquiry kicked off last week, an NBC News analysis stated that the early testimony "lacked the pizzazz necessary to capture public attention." The comment was widely mocked on social media, and "Saturday Night Live" parodied the complaint by turning the hearings into a melodramatic soap opera "to make sure people are paying attention."

title: Robocall Scams Exist Because They Work-One Woman's Story Shows How
summary: A caller impersonating an FBI agent persuaded Nina Belis to drain close to $340,000 from her bank accounts. The FBI agent sounded official on the phone. He gave Nina Belis his badge number and a story about how her identity had been compromised. She gave him her life's savings.

title: Wealthy Buyers Are Jumping Between Billionaires' Row Towers
summary: Moneyed apartment hunters are swapping some of the corridor's highest-profile buildings for newer, shinier towers like 111 West 57th Street and 220 Central Park South. With new mega-towers sprouting up all over New York's Billionaires' Row, wealthy buyers are starting to play musical chairs across buildings.

title: Luxury Leases That Reach Six Figures
summary: How the most expensive rentals in seven cities stack up against each other. A home with a $500,000 price tag wouldn't raise eyebrows in most of the country. But imagine paying that amount every month, which is the case with one luxury six-bedroom in Manhattan.

title: Back to School Doesn't Have to Mean Back to the Dorm
summary: Adults who are embracing summer university programs are finding an alternative to its primary downside: dorm living.. A few months ago, Susan Lobell returned to St. John's College, her alma mater, to study themes of art, relationships, memory and love in Virginia Woolf's novels. Her husband, also an alum, took a class comparing and contrasting plays by Euripides, Sophocles and Aeschylus.

title: Luxury Crash Pads Near Colleges
summary: Adult vacationers taking summer classes don't need to resort to dorm living. A few more luxurious options near Cornell University and St. John's College.. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: The Secret Messages of Swaying Trees
summary: Measuring the way a tree moves in the wind can reveal a lot about its internal structure.. Here in London, I regularly run on a path by the Thames that is covered by a beautiful canopy of trees. After a night of howling wind, I often find huge broken branches obstructing my path, casualties of the wind's violent pummeling. The leafy top of a tree acts like a sail, and the force on the tree as it is caught by gusts of strong wind is enormous. Yet those splintered boughs are the exception, since most trees manage to withstand the storm.

title: The Wall That Would Save Venice Is Underwater
summary: When floods arrived this month, a project to block out the sea wasn't ready, slowed by corruption and bureaucracy. VENICE, Italy-As the water rose, Alessandro Ferro made a desperate effort to prevent a devastating flood on the islands of the Venetian Lagoon.

title: 'Sesame Street' Wasn't the First to Make Learning Fun
summary: The show turns 50 this month, but the idea that education can be entertaining goes back to ancient Greece.. "Sesame Street," which first went on the air 50 years ago this month, is one of the most successful and cost-effective tools ever created for preparing preschool tots for the classroom. Now showing in 70 languages in more than 150 countries around the world, "Sesame Street" is that rare thing in a child's life: truly educational entertainment.

title: U.S. Existing-Home Sales Increased 1.9% in October
summary: Gains concentrated in higher-priced homes; lack of inventory has driven prices up this year. Sales of higher-priced homes picked up last month, but those involving starter homes and others aimed at lower- and middle-income buyers were slowed by a lack of inventory.

title: Emerging-Market Losses Hurt Ashmore Fund
summary: Near-simultaneous losses from large investments in Argentina, Lebanon and Ecuador hit the emerging-markets bond mutual fund. A large emerging-markets bond fund that bet almost 40% of its investors' money in a trio of risky countries is struggling as all three economies fall into crisis simultaneously.

title: European Financial Stocks Poised for Best Year Since 2013
summary: Exchange operators and asset managers see shares soar even as the region's banks continue to slump. European financial stocks are headed for their best year in the last six as investors bet on takeovers among the region's biggest exchange operators and improving prospects for asset managers.

title: Global Economy to Stagnate if Trade War Persists, OECD Warns
summary: Paris-based organization says it doesn't expect a pickup in global growth until 2021. The global economy is at risk of settling into a low-growth rut without urgent action to roll back recently erected obstacles to trade and greater investment in tackling climate change, the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development said Thursday.

title: Why Anthony Hopkins Doesn't Research His Roles
summary: In 'The Two Popes,' the prolific actor-who's played King Lear, Richard Nixon and Pablo Picasso-turns his attention to another iconic role: the first pope to resign since the 15th century. Anthony Hopkins, who plays Pope Benedict XVI in this month's Netflix movie The Two Popes, has a personal philosophy of not taking anything too seriously. "When I was younger, I was much more intense," he says. "I got to a certain age, maybe 10 years ago, and thought, 'Come on, just relax. Have some fun with it. Let's have a ball!'" Hopkins's surprising approach to playing the pope was to be as laid back as the actor, 81, appears on his lively Instagram account: He captures himself singing, dancing in his Thor costume and playing the piano with his cat perched on his lap.

title: Apple's Domestic Bliss
summary: Plan to produce Mac Pro in Texas wins White House raves, but uber-high price will keep the machine from the masses. Apple Inc. is making its new Mac Pro at home. Which is fitting, as the device hardly needs an extra shipping surcharge.

title: Once Upon a Time in Hollywood, Reboots Ruled-Now, Not So Much
summary: There is waning interest in remakes, sequels and spinoffs, such as Charlie's Angels and Terminator, that aren't adaptations of comic books.

title: Derek Jeter's Players' Tribune Gets New Owner
summary: Digital platform Minute Media acquires site the former Yankee created for athletes to tell their stories. The Players' Tribune, the digital media venture launched by former New York Yankees captain Derek Jeter, is joining a new team.

title: Trump Blames Beijing for Lagging Trade Talks
summary: President says China isn't making enough effort in negotiations, signals Apple might be spared fresh tariffs. AUSTIN, Texas-President Trump criticized China's efforts to reach a trade agreement during a visit to a Texas plant where Apple Inc. is assembling its new desktop computer.

title: End of Libor Creates Uncertainty for CME's Giant Eurodollar Market
summary: Navigating the transition from Libor to another benchmark rate is critical for CME, which has made billions of dollars from Eurodollar futures. The clock is ticking on a huge futures market where nearly $3 trillion changes hands on an average day.

title: Why Some Unions Are Losing Members
summary: Year after Supreme Court ruling that loosened union rules, some report drops in revenue, members. Some public-workers unions are experiencing steep losses of members and fees, dips largely triggered by a 2018 Supreme Court ruling that gave members an out.

title: One in Four Europeans Holds Anti-Semitic Views, Survey Shows
summary: Sharp rise in Eastern Europe since 2015. Nearly one in four, 24.6%, of Europeans holds strongly anti-Semitic views, according to a poll by a Jewish anti-hate organization released Thursday.

title: China's Disappearing Data: The Saga Continues
summary: Official statistics suggest small-business lending-a crucial ingredient for growth-is booming. The truth is less rosy, but not as dire as it was.. How are small businesses, the engine of China's spectacular rise over the past 30 years, doing these days? The answer depends on which regulator you ask-and which data set you believe.

title: Robots Are Taking Over (the Rental Screening Process)
summary: Landlords are using artificial intelligence to vet prospective renters. For decades, when you applied for an apartment, the landlord-or a tenant screening company hired by the landlord-would examine your credit file and pay stubs to verify your ability to pay rent. But today, landlords are using the artificial intelligence revolution to predict something else: Your willingness to pay rent.

title: Former U.K. Consulate Worker Says Chinese Secret Police Tortured Him
summary: Hong Kong citizen claims he was beaten, deprived of sleep and interrogated for days in an effort to prove Britain was behind demonstrations. HONG KONG-A former employee of Britain's Hong Kong consulate claimed Chinese secret police beat him, deprived him of sleep and chained him spread-eagled as they pressed him for information about activists leading the pro-democracy protests that have swept the city since June.

title: Sonos Finds Its Voice
summary: Acquisition lets speaker maker hedge exposure on Amazon, Google voice platforms. Sonos has wisely tried to stay neutral in Big Tech's voice-platform war. Sometimes staying neutral means going on the offensive, though.

title: Kroger Dials Back Overhaul as Sales Sputter
summary: Supermarket chain lost ground while making investments in stores and tech. Kroger Co. is turning back to the basics of selling groceries after trying to sell too many new products and renovate too many stores at once.

title: This Chinese Tech Star Needs to Learn From WeWork
summary: Nasdaq-listed e-commerce stock Pinduoduo has been racking up mounting losses in its quest for growth. Growth is no longer the only item on tech investors' shopping list. That goes for Chinese e-commerce star Pinduoduo as much as for Uber and WeWork.

title: China Invited U.S. Trade Negotiators for Direct Talks
summary: Chinese officials hope the in-person talks with the U.S. can take place before Thanksgiving. BEIJING-China's chief trade negotiator has invited his American counterparts for a new round of face-to-face talks, according to people briefed on the matter, as both sides are struggling to strike a limited deal to help de-escalate tensions between the world's two largest economies.

title: Thyssenkrupp Losses Widen as New CEO Pushes Unit Sale
summary: The once-mighty industrial icon is fighting for survival amid a steep downturn. BERLIN- Thyssenkrupp AG , the German industrial icon fighting for survival amid a manufacturing slump, said it would scrap its dividend and accelerate efforts to sell its most profitable division as losses widened and the outlook for the coming year worsened.

title: Ukraine Inquired About Aid on Same Day as Trump-Zelensky Call, Official Testifies
summary: Defense Department official Laura Cooper says Kyiv wanted to know status of the nearly $400 million in security assistance. WASHINGTON-A Pentagon official told House impeachment investigators that Ukraine inquired about the status of frozen security aid on the same day that President Trump asked Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyto launch investigations that could benefit him politically.

title: Democratic Candidates Unite Against Trump, Divide on Taxes, Health Care
summary: Pete Buttigieg faces increased attention after recent rise in polls. Ten leading Democratic presidential candidates opened the party's fifth debate united in lambasting President Trump, but rifts then opened on an array of issues including health care, taxes and race.

title: Massachusetts Lawmakers Pass Bill to Ban Flavored Tobacco
summary: The measure is intended to combat youth vaping, overall tobacco use. Massachusetts lawmakers passed a bill in the early morning hours Thursday to enact the country's most stringent state ban on flavored tobacco, including menthol cigarettes, in an effort to combat youth tobacco use.

title: How the Discount Window Became a Pain in the Repo Market
summary: The stigma attached to borrowing from the Fed's emergency lending window has contributed to recent turmoil in overnight lending markets. Banks have all but abandoned the Federal Reserve's discount window, and it is straining Wall Street's postcrisis infrastructure.
